noun.description: A yellow-flowered shrub of the pea family, the leaves of which are modified to form spines, native to western Europe and North Africa.
examples: sheep graze on undulating green hills blooming with yellow gorse
on the 11th hole his drive ended up in a gorse bush

origin: Old English gors, gorst, from an Indo-European root meaning rough, prickly, shared by German Gerste and Latin hordeum barley.
